intro: Englerophytum oubanguiense, commonly known as the Oubangui sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically succulent, adapted to arid environments, and it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Englerophytum oubanguiense is often found in dry savannas and is well-suited to regions with seasonal rainfall.
